oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Excerpt 2 from oral history interview with Mary Frances Berry, 2003 September 05
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville Civil Rights Movement participant Mary Frances Berry, conducted on 5 September 2003 by John Egerton as part of the Nashville Public Library's Civil Rights Oral History Project. Berry discusses the day that the Brown v. the Board of Education of Topeka decision came down and her reaction to it. The complete interview, as well as a transcript, is available in the repository.
